title: Who wore it best? Strictly Come Dancing, week five: the costumier's verdict
text:
Following last week’s controversial elimination, the couples again took to the Strictly dancefloor in plenty of interesting costumes last night in an effort to prove they deserve to stay.

I think last week's dance-off survivor Emma Weymouth wore the most impressive costume of the night for her Viennese Waltz. Waltz dresses normally have long, sweeping, full-length skirts that help to elongate movements and this was no exception. The “Post-It notes” squares on the sleeve, chest and hem were odd but somehow worked beautifully. I imagine these squares were probably laser cut from a thick pleather material and hand stitched down on one side to create the textured effect.

Catherine Tyldesley also...
